primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, the source of all righteousness, intervenes in a world of injustice and spiritual famine to restore His people and empower them for service through His Word.

object.identificatie: Justice, righteousness, and the restoration of the 'undeserving poor'

zender.identificatie: God as the 'Mighty Source' / Lord of Hosts
tekstueel_bewijs: YHWH, the God of hosts, is his name!
we too are called by that same Lord

helper.identificatie: The Prophets, MLK Jr., and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit that animated Amos

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, idolatry, and the 'famine of the Word'
tekstueel_bewijs: a famine... of hearing the words of the Lord
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just social injustice but the withdrawal of God's life-giving presence (the Word).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church's response to God's initiative through social action and charity.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Congregation/Parish
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Feeding the hungry, sheltering the homeless
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly presented as a result of having 'received this Word' (soteriology).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit/Prophets → God ← Sin/Famine of the Word

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has used us in this parish
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we could not stand in our pulpits

voorbeelden: sacrifice some portion of our standard of living
we yearn for the mighty stream
I knew certain parts of Amos by heart
The Word... is what has the power
with God; all things are possible

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to effect change where human 'Vouloir' and 'Devoir' fail.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Sham' (Not-S1) to 'Judgment' (S2), then revealing the 'Word' (S1) as the only source of 'Restoration' (Not-S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's sovereign character; He is both the judge and the source of the righteousness He demands.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the famine of the Word is described as the 'most fearful loss of all'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon deals heavily with social justice (often a site for moralism), it consistently identifies God as the sole Subject and Source of both the desire and the power for justice.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The mention of MLK Jr. and Whitney North Seymour.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is the spring... God is the ever-rolling stream.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: MLK Jr. is used as an example, but immediately reframed as a 'servant of God's mighty purpose' rather than a self-generated hero.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides it: King was 'overpowered by his vocation from God'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; the burden of 'saving the world' is shifted to God.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification; God works in and through the believer.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'doom' of Amos to the 'grace' of the Gospel is handled via the character of God as 'Source'.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'must' of social justice and the 'cannot' of human nature.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: align ourselves with God’s great movement

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (strength to continue).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as being 'purged of sins'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the narrative engine, even when discussing ethical imperatives.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon already balances the 'Devoir' of Amos with the 'Pouvoir' of Christ.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'Famine of the Word' is a high-stakes opponent.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that addresses social issues without falling into the trap of moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the New Yorker article; Greimas shows that the article serves as a 'lack' (Opponent) that only God (Subject) can fill.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Amos's context; Greimas shows how the 'engine' of the text is transferred to the modern hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Source' is not just a metaphor but the primary Actant (Sender/Subject) of the entire sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of Fleming Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace'.
